item.title: awscurl for AWS Elasticsearch Service (via Homebrew)
item.description: I was recently working on a project that was leveraging Amazon’s Elasticsearch service. We were fortunate enough to be able to deploy this in our VPC - which is the recommended way to do so. The VPC adds a nice security layer, but unfortunately still lets everything in your VPC talk to your database - which is not following best security practices. So, to lock this down a little more, we decided to only let certain user groups talk to the database.

item.title: Github Pages, GitHub Actions, and Hugo
item.description: For the last few years I’ve had my personal website hosted via GitHub Pages. To make my life even easier I’ve always used a static site generator; first I used Pelican and most recently had it set up with Nikola - both were great. Nikola is especially nice as it made deploying Jupyter notebooks as blog posts incredibly easy. Recently I’ve wanted to mess with the style of my site a bit more.
